Remarks: specimen glued on a triangle, abdomen and genitalia preserved in polyethylene micro vial with glycerin.

Paratype with labels: (1) “ Perú // Chanchamayo // La merced” [old white label, handwritten in black ink]. (2) “MHN // 2460” [white label, handwritten in black ink]. (3) “Parátipo” [red label, handwritten in black ink]. (4) “ Cratosomus (C.) // euneatus // peruviensis // K49 Ksehx.” [white label, handwritten in black ink, all text into a black box].

Paratype with labels: (1) “Perú // Huanuco[Department of Huanuco] // 1900m [meters of altitude in relation to sea level] // 1.3[March].[19]47. // Weyrauch” [old white label, handwritten in black ink]. (2) “Parátipo” [red label, handwritten in black ink]. (3) “Donativo // col. Weyrauch” [old white label, handwritten in black ink]. (4) “MHN // 2464” [old white label, handwritten in black ink]. (5) “ Lixus [underlined] delatus [underlined] KUSCHEL”.

[meters of altitude in relation to sea level] // 12°50'S 069°20'W ” [white label, printed in black ink]. (2) “ Smithsonian Institution // Canpopy Fogging Preject // T.L. Erwin et al. colls. //
10May
[19]84 04/[slash on label]02/[slash on label] 048” [white label, "/048" in 4th line handwritten in black ink, other information printed in black]. (3) “FOGGING // 0051590” [white label, printed in black ink]. (4) “ ERWIN // Smithsonian ” [white label, handwritten in black ink]. (5) “94-47-48” [yellow label, handwritten in black ink]. (6) “ HOLOTYPE // Pandeleteius // smithsoni // A. Howden ” [red label, 3rd line handwritten in black ink, other information printed in black].

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: specimen glued on a triangle.

Paratype with labels: (1) “Perú // Tingo m.[maría] // 11[November].[19]46 // Weyrauch” [old white label, handwritten in black ink]. (2) “Parátipo” [red label, handwritten in black ink]. (3) “Donativo ex // col. Weyrauch” [old white label, handwritten in black ink]. (4) “MHN // 2465” [old white label, handwritten in black ink]. (5) “ Spermologus // weyrauchi // KSCHL. // det. g. Kuschel [19]49” [old white label, handwritten in black ink].
Remarks: two specimens in the insect pin, each specimen glued on a triangle.
